intro: Silene tomentella, commonly known as the woolly catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine and arid environments. Silene tomentella is a perennial herb that is adapted to survive in harsh, low-nutrient soils.
